fields.name: Monstera
fields.description: Monstera is a tropical plant that is known for its large, glossy leaves with unique splits and holes. It is a popular choice for indoor gardening and can grow quite large, making it a stunning focal point in any room.

care_info.water: Water when the top inch of soil is dry

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced liquid fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.
fields.pests: Watch for spider mites and mealybugs. Treat with insecticidal soap if necessary.
fields.pruning: Prune to remove any dead or yellowing leaves and to control size. Use clean, sharp scissors.
fields.repotting: Repot every 1-2 years or when the plant outgrows its pot. Use a well-draining potting mix.
fields.delivery: Ships in a 6-inch pot. Delivery time: 5-7 business days.
fields.planting: Plant in a well-draining potting mix. Water thoroughly after planting.
fields.size: Can grow up to 10 feet tall indoors with proper care.

fields.name: African violet
fields.description: African violet is a popular houseplant known for its beautiful, velvety leaves and vibrant purple flowers. It thrives in moderate light and requires regular watering to keep the soil moist but not soggy.

fields.delivery: Ships in a 4-inch pot. Delivery time: 5-7 business days.
fields.planting: Plant in a well-draining potting mix. Water thoroughly after planting.

fields.name: Aloe Vera
fields.description: Aloe Vera is a succulent plant known for its medicinal properties and ability to thrive in dry conditions. It has thick, fleshy leaves that store water, making it a low-maintenance houseplant.

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced liquid fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.

fields.name: Tomato seeds
fields.description: High-quality tomato seeds for home gardening. Grow juicy, flavorful tomatoes easily in your garden or pots. Suitable for beginners and experienced gardeners alike.

care_info.water: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.
fields.pests: Watch for aphids and cutworms. Treat with insecticidal soap if necessary.
fields.pruning: Prune to remove any dead or yellowing leaves and to encourage bushier growth you can leave side shoots. Use clean, sharp scissors.
fields.repotting: Not applicable for this plant. Ensure proper spacing in the garden.
fields.delivery: Ships in a seed packet. Delivery time: 5-7 business days.
fields.planting: Plant in a well-draining potting mix. Water thoroughly after planting. Sow indoors February to April and move outdoors after the last frost between May and June.
fields.harvesting: Harvest when tomatoes are fully ripe and have a deep color from July to October. Protect from frost, move indoors if necessary
fields.size: Can grow up to 6 feet tall with proper care.

fields.name: Chili seeds
fields.description: Organic chili seed bag for home gardening. Grow your own spicy, flavorful chili peppers easily. Perfect for adding heat and taste to your dishes.

care_info.water: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.
fields.pests: Watch for aphids and spider mites. Treat with insecticidal soap if necessary.
fields.pruning: Prune to remove any dead or yellowing leaves. Use clean, sharp scissors.
fields.repotting: Not applicable for this plant. Ensure proper spacing in the garden.
fields.delivery: Ships in a seed packet. Delivery time: 5-7 business days.
fields.planting: Plant in a well-draining potting mix. Water thoroughly after planting. Sow indoors February to May and for best results keep it in the greenhouse.
fields.harvesting: Harvest when peppers are fully ripe and have a deep color. Protect from frost, move indoors if necessary. You can harvest in summer and autumn.
fields.size: Can grow up to 2 feet tall with proper care.

fields.name: 'Conference' Pear Tree
fields.description: The Conference Pear Tree is a popular fruit tree known for its long, narrow pears with a sweet, juicy flavor. It is easy to grow, produces abundant crops, and is ideal for home gardens. The fruit is excellent for eating fresh or using in desserts and preserves.

care_info.water: Water regularly, especially during dry spells

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced fertilizer in early spring before new growth begins.
fields.pests: Watch for aphids and pear psylla. Treat with insecticidal soap if necessary.
fields.pruning: Prune in late winter or early spring to shape the tree and remove dead or diseased wood.
fields.repotting: Not applicable for trees. Ensure proper spacing in the garden.
fields.delivery: Ships as a bare-root tree. Delivery time: 7-10 business days.
fields.planting: Plant in well-draining soil. Soak roots in water before planting. Dig a hole twice the width of the root ball and backfill with soil and organic manure.
fields.harvesting: Can set fruit without pollinated. Harvest when pears are firm and have a slight give when pressed, usually October to November.
fields.size: Can grow up to 15-25 feet tall with proper care.

fields.name: 'Cox' Apple Tree
fields.description: The 'Cox' Apple Tree is a popular fruit tree known for its sweet, crisp apples with a rich flavor. It is easy to grow, produces abundant crops, and is ideal for home gardens. The fruit is excellent for eating fresh or using in desserts and preserves.

care_info.water: Water regularly, especially during dry spells

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced fertilizer in early spring before new growth begins.
fields.pests: Watch for aphids and apple maggot. Treat with insecticidal soap if necessary.
fields.pruning: Prune in late winter or early spring to shape the tree and remove dead or diseased wood.
fields.repotting: Not applicable for trees. Ensure proper spacing in the garden.
fields.delivery: Ships as a bare-root tree. Delivery time: 7-10 business days.
fields.planting: Plant in well-draining soil. Soak roots in water before planting. Dig a hole twice the width of the root ball and backfill with soil and organic manure.
fields.harvesting: Harvest when apples are firm and have a slight give when pressed, usually from late September to October.
fields.size: Can grow up to 12 feet tall with proper care.

fields.name: Mix of colourful Tulips
fields.description: A vibrant mix of colourful tulip bulbs, perfect for adding a burst of spring color to your garden. These easy-to-grow tulips bloom in a variety of shades, creating a stunning and cheerful display.

care_info.water: Water regularly, especially during dry spells

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced fertilizer in early spring before new growth begins.
fields.pests: Watch for aphids and slugs. Treat with insecticidal soap if necessary.
fields.pruning: Prune spent flowers to encourage new growth. Remove any dead or yellowing leaves.
fields.repotting: Not applicable for bulbs. Plant directly in the garden.
fields.delivery: Ships as a bulb pack. Delivery time: 5-7 business days.
fields.planting: Plant bulbs in well-draining soil, 6-8 inches deep in late autumn. Water thoroughly after planting.
fields.harvesting: Harvest when flowers are fully open and have a vibrant color.

fields.name: Daffodils
fields.description: Daffodils are cheerful spring-blooming flowers known for their bright yellow or white petals and trumpet-shaped centers. They are easy to grow, thrive in most gardens, and symbolize renewal and new beginnings.

care_info.water: Water regularly, especially during dry spells

fields.fertilizer: Use a balanced fertilizer in early spring before new growth begins.
fields.pests: Watch for narcissus bulb fly and daffodil eelworms. Treat with insecticidal soap if necessary.
fields.pruning: Prune spent flowers to encourage new growth. Remove any dead or yellowing leaves.
fields.repotting: Not applicable for bulbs. Plant directly in the garden.
fields.delivery: Ships as a bulb pack. Delivery time: 5-7 business days.
fields.planting: Plant bulbs in well-draining soil, 6-8 inches deep in late autumn. Water thoroughly after planting.
fields.harvesting: Harvest when flowers are fully open and have a vibrant color.
